provisions.content: (1) The funds of the University include The funds of the University include moneys approved by Parliament; moneys approved by Parliament; internally generated funds including internally generated funds including fees paid by students duly registered by the University; fees paid by students duly registered by the University; fees, charges and dues in respect of services rendered by or through the University; fees, charges and dues in respect of services rendered by or through the University; proceeds from the sale of publications of the University; proceeds from the sale of publications of the University; tuition and hostel fees; and tuition and hostel fees; and subscriptions, rents and royalties; subscriptions, rents and royalties; returns on investments; returns on investments; endowments, grants, donations, loans and gifts; and endowments, grants, donations, loans and gifts; and moneys from any other source approved by the Council. moneys from any other source approved by the Council. (2) Any sum of money received by or on behalf of the University shall be paid into a bank account of the University opened by or on the authority of the Council. Any sum of money received by or on behalf of the University shall be paid into a bank account of the University opened by or on the authority of the Council. (3) Moneys received by or standing to the credit of a School, Centre or Institute of the University shall form part of the funds of the University. Moneys received by or standing to the credit of a School, Centre or Institute of the University shall form part of the funds of the University. (4) The Council may invest the funds of the University that are not required for immediate use as the Council considers appropriate. The Council may invest the funds of the University that are not required for immediate use as the Council considers appropriate.

provisions.title: Borrowing powers
provisions.content: (1) Subject to article 181 of the Constitution and section 76 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921), the University may borrow money. Subject to article 181 of the Constitution and section 76 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921), the University may borrow money. provisions.title: Internal Audit Unit
provisions.content: (1) The University shall have an Internal Audit Unit in accordance with section 83 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921). The University shall have an Internal Audit Unit in accordance with section 83 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921). (2) The Internal Audit Unit shall be headed by an Internal Auditor who shall be appointed in accordance with the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658). The Internal Audit Unit shall be headed by an Internal Auditor who shall be appointed in accordance with the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658). (3) The Internal Auditor is responsible for the internal audit of the University. The Internal Auditor is responsible for the internal audit of the University. (4) The Internal Auditor shall, subject to subsections (3) and (4) of section 16 of the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658), at intervals of three months The Internal Auditor shall, subject to subsections (3) and (4) of section 16 of the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658), at intervals of three months prepare and submit to the Council, a report on the internal audit carried out during the period of three months immediately preceding the preparation of the report; and prepare and submit to the Council, a report on the internal audit carried out during the period of three months immediately preceding the preparation of the report; and make recommendations in each report with respect to matters which appear to the Internal Auditor as necessary for the conduct of the affairs of the University. make recommendations in each report with respect to matters which appear to the Internal Auditor as necessary for the conduct of the affairs of the University. (5) The Internal Auditor shall, in accordance with subsection (4) of section 16 of the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658), submit a copy of each report prepared under this section to the Minister and the chairperson of the Council. The Internal Auditor shall, in accordance with subsection (4) of section 16 of the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658), submit a copy of each report prepared under this section to the Minister and the chairperson of the Council.

provisions.title: Accounts and audit
provisions.content: (1) The Council shall ensure that the University keeps books of account, records, returns and other documents relevant to the accounts in the form approved by the Auditor-General. The Council shall ensure that the University keeps books of account, records, returns and other documents relevant to the accounts in the form approved by the Auditor-General. (2) The Council shall submit the annual accounts of the University to the Auditor-General for audit at the end of the financial year. The Council shall submit the annual accounts of the University to the Auditor-General for audit at the end of the financial year. (3) The accounts shall be under the signature of the Vice-Chancellor and the Director of Finance. The accounts shall be under the signature of the Vice-Chancellor and the Director of Finance. (4) The Auditor-General shall, within six months after the end of the immediately preceding financial year, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister and the Council. The Auditor-General shall, within six months after the end of the immediately preceding financial year, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister and the Council. (5) The financial year of the University is the same as the financial year of the Government. The financial year of the University is the same as the financial year of the Government.

provisions.title: Annual report and other reports
provisions.content: (1) The Council shall within thirty days after receipt of the audit report, submit to the Minister an annual report covering the activities and the operations of the University for the year to which the report relates. The Council shall within thirty days after receipt of the audit report, submit to the Minister an annual report covering the activities and the operations of the University for the year to which the report relates. (2) The annual report includes The annual report includes the report of the Auditor-General; the report of the Auditor-General; a report on the operations, admissions, sources and use of the funds of the University, challenges, significant events and major policies of the University; and a report on the operations, admissions, sources and use of the funds of the University, challenges, significant events and major policies of the University; and any other information that may be required by the Minister in conformity with the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921) or that may be relevant to enhance transparency and accountability. any other information that may be required by the Minister in conformity with the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921) or that may be relevant to enhance transparency and accountability. (3) The Minister shall, within thirty days after the receipt of the annual report from the University, submit the report to Parliament with a statement that the Minister considers necessary. The Minister shall, within thirty days after the receipt of the annual report from the University, submit the report to Parliament with a statement that the Minister considers necessary. (4) The Council shall submit to the Minister any other reports which the Minister may, in writing, require. provisions.title: Exemption from taxes, duties and other charges
provisions.content: (1) The University is exempt from the payment of taxes, duties and other charges that the Minister responsible for Finance may, in writing, determine with the prior approval of Parliament. (2) A hall, hostel and any other residential facilities for students, lecture hall, library, hospital, staff quarter, bungalow, guest house, recreation ground and any other tenements of the University shall be exempt from the assessment and payment of a rate levied by a local authority. A hall, hostel and any other residential facilities for students, lecture hall, library, hospital, staff quarter, bungalow, guest house, recreation ground and any other tenements of the University shall be exempt from the assessment and payment of a rate levied by a local authority.

provisions.title: Statutes of the University
provisions.content: (1) The Council shall enact Statutes of the University for the implementation of this Act. The Council shall enact Statutes of the University for the implementation of this Act. (2) The Statutes of the University shall The Statutes of the University shall regulate the following in respect of the employees of the University: regulate the following in respect of the employees of the University: appointment; appointment; terms and conditions of service as determined by the Fair Wages and Salaries Commission; terms and conditions of service as determined by the Fair Wages and Salaries Commission; termination of appointment; and termination of appointment; and retirement benefits; retirement benefits; determine the persons who form the academic staff of the University; determine the persons who form the academic staff of the University; determine the persons who are authorised to sign contracts, cheques and other documents on behalf of the University and regulate the procedure in relation to transactions entered into by the University; determine the persons who are authorised to sign contracts, cheques and other documents on behalf of the University and regulate the procedure in relation to transactions entered into by the University; fix the academic calendar of the University; fix the academic calendar of the University; determine the rules and procedures relating to discipline of students and employees of the University; determine the rules and procedures relating to discipline of students and employees of the University; ensure that the seal of the University is kept under proper custody and is used only on the authority of the Council; ensure that the seal of the University is kept under proper custody and is used only on the authority of the Council; provide for the procedure for the settlement of disputes; and provide for the procedure for the settlement of disputes; and provide for any matter required by this Act to be prescribed by the Statutes of the University. provide for any matter required by this Act to be prescribed by the Statutes of the University.

provisions.title: Convocation
provisions.content: (1) There shall be a Convocation of the University with the membership prescribed by the Statutes of the University. There shall be a Convocation of the University with the membership prescribed by the Statutes of the University. (2) The Registrar shall compile a register of the members of Convocation which shall be published each academic year. The Registrar shall compile a register of the members of Convocation which shall be published each academic year. (3) A person whose name appears in the register is entitled to vote at the Convocation. A person whose name appears in the register is entitled to vote at the Convocation. (4) The Convocation shall meet at least once each academic year at the time and place determined by the Vice-Chancellor in consultation with the Chancellor. The Convocation shall meet at least once each academic year at the time and place determined by the Vice-Chancellor in consultation with the Chancellor. (5) Despite subsection (4), the Convocation shall meet on a request made by a number of members as prescribed in the Statutes of the University. Despite subsection (4), the Convocation shall meet on a request made by a number of members as prescribed in the Statutes of the University. (6) The Convocation shall receive and discuss a report from the Vice-Chancellor on the state of the University and future plans for the University. The Convocation shall receive and discuss a report from the Vice-Chancellor on the state of the University and future plans for the University. (7) The Convocation may express an opinion on any matter that affects the University and may refer the matter to the Council or the Academic Board. The Convocation may express an opinion on any matter that affects the University and may refer the matter to the Council or the Academic Board.

provisions.title: Matriculation
provisions.content: (1) A student admitted to the University shall A student admitted to the University shall take the Matriculation Oath; and take the Matriculation Oath; and sign the Matriculation Register. sign the Matriculation Register. (2) The University shall not permit a student who fails to sign the Matriculation Register to graduate. The University shall not permit a student who fails to sign the Matriculation Register to graduate.

provisions.title: Congregation
provisions.content: The University may hold a Congregation composed of the persons prescribed by the Statutes of the University enacted by the Council for the purpose of confering degrees including honoray degrees and awarding diplomas or certificates. The University may hold a Congregation composed of the persons prescribed by the Statutes of the University enacted by the Council for the purpose of confering degrees including honoray degrees and awarding diplomas or certificates.

provisions.title: Student governance
provisions.content: (1) The University shall have a Students’ Representative Council. The University shall have a Students’ Representative Council. (2) The Students’ Representative Council is responsible for representing students duly admitted and registered to study at the University. The Students’ Representative Council is responsible for representing students duly admitted and registered to study at the University. (3) The constitution and other governing instruments of the Students’ Representative Council shall The constitution and other governing instruments of the Students’ Representative Council shall be drawn up by the students subject to the approval of the Academic Board; and be drawn up by the students subject to the approval of the Academic Board; and conform to this Act, the Statutes of the University and any other rules, regulations, directives and edicts duly issued by the University. conform to this Act, the Statutes of the University and any other rules, regulations, directives and edicts duly issued by the University. (4) A constitution or a governing instrument, drawn up by the Students’ Representative Council which is inconsistent with paragraph (b) of subsection (3) shall, to the extent of the inconsistency, be void. A constitution or a governing instrument, drawn up by the Students’ Representative Council which is inconsistent with paragraph (b) of subsection (3) shall, to the extent of the inconsistency, be void. provisions.title: Intellectual property
provisions.content: (1) The intellectual property right in a creative work, research or any other intellectual enterprise, funded or otherwise undertaken with resources of the University, shall vest in the University. The intellectual property right in a creative work, research or any other intellectual enterprise, funded or otherwise undertaken with resources of the University, shall vest in the University. (2) The Council shall enact Statutes of the University in accordance with the laws on intellectual property to govern the creation, ownership and use of intellectual property including copyright, patents, trademarks, trade names and industrial designs by employees of the University. The Council shall enact Statutes of the University in accordance with the laws on intellectual property to govern the creation, ownership and use of intellectual property including copyright, patents, trademarks, trade names and industrial designs by employees of the University. (3) The Council shall, in enacting the Statutes of the University under subsection (2), determine the incentive for a person who undertakes any work, research or other intellectual enterprise, funded or otherwise undertaken with resources of the University to enable that person benefit from the work, research or intellectual enterprise. The Council shall, in enacting the Statutes of the University under subsection (2), determine the incentive for a person who undertakes any work, research or other intellectual enterprise, funded or otherwise undertaken with resources of the University to enable that person benefit from the work, research or intellectual enterprise.

provisions.title: Anti-discrimination
provisions.content: (1) Without limiting the power of the University to adopt affirmative action policies, the University or an officer of the University shall not discriminate against a person on the basis of the race, ethnic origin, political opinion, colour, gender, occupation, religion or creed, disability, social or economic status of that person to determine whether that person is to be Without limiting the power of the University to adopt affirmative action policies, the University or an officer of the University shall not discriminate against a person on the basis of the race, ethnic origin, political opinion, colour, gender, occupation, religion or creed, disability, social or economic status of that person to determine whether that person is to be admitted as a student of the University; admitted as a student of the University; registered as a student of the University; registered as a student of the University; permitted to graduate from the University; permitted to graduate from the University; appointed as an academic staff or other staff member of the University; appointed as an academic staff or other staff member of the University; promoted as an academic staff or any other member of the University; or promoted as an academic staff or any other member of the University; or granted any advantage, privilege or other benefit accorded to other persons. granted any advantage, privilege or other benefit accorded to other persons. (2) For the purpose of this section For the purpose of this section “discriminate” means to give different treatment to different persons attributable only or mainly on the grounds stated in subsection (1); and “discriminate” means to give different treatment to different persons attributable only or mainly on the grounds stated in subsection (1); and “officer of the University” includes(i)a Principal Officer;(ii)a staff;(iii)an employee;(iv)an agent;(v)a servant; or(vi)any other person performing or acting in an official capacity for or on behalf of the University. “officer of the University” includes a Principal Officer; a staff; an employee; an agent; a servant; or any other person performing or acting in an official capacity for or on behalf of the University.

provisions.title: Dispute settlement
provisions.content: (1) The University shall have an Appeals Board. The University shall have an Appeals Board. (2) The Appeals Board shall consist of The Appeals Board shall consist of a chairperson who is a retired Justice of the Superior Courts of Judicature or a lawyer qualified to be appointed as a Justice of the Superior Courts of Judicature; a chairperson who is a retired Justice of the Superior Courts of Judicature or a lawyer qualified to be appointed as a Justice of the Superior Courts of Judicature; two lawyers of at least ten years standing at the Bar who are persons of high moral integrity and professional integrity, at least one of whom is a woman; and two lawyers of at least ten years standing at the Bar who are persons of high moral integrity and professional integrity, at least one of whom is a woman; and two other persons of high moral integrity who are not lawyers or employees of the University, at least one of whom is a woman. two other persons of high moral integrity who are not lawyers or employees of the University, at least one of whom is a woman. (3) The Council shall appoint the members of the Appeals Board. The Council shall appoint the members of the Appeals Board. (4) The Appeals Board shall hear and determine on appeal, matters on The Appeals Board shall hear and determine on appeal, matters on an act or omission in contravention of this Act or the Statutes of the University; an act or omission in contravention of this Act or the Statutes of the University; breach of an employment contract by the University; breach of an employment contract by the University; the promotion of persons duly employed by the University; the promotion of persons duly employed by the University; grievances by a student against the University on matters related to welfare and discipline; or grievances by a student against the University on matters related to welfare and discipline; or any other matter or dispute referred to the Appeals Board by the Council. any other matter or dispute referred to the Appeals Board by the Council. (5) A panel for the hearing and determination of a case or matter before the Appeals Board comprises the chairperson and two other members of the Appeals Board. A panel for the hearing and determination of a case or matter before the Appeals Board comprises the chairperson and two other members of the Appeals Board. (6) In the absence of the chairperson, one of the two lawyers as specified in paragraph (b) of subsection (2), shall act as chairperson. In the absence of the chairperson, one of the two lawyers as specified in paragraph (b) of subsection (2), shall act as chairperson. (7) The Council shall establish the rules and procedure to govern The Council shall establish the rules and procedure to govern the proceedings of the Appeals Board; the proceedings of the Appeals Board; the appointment and remuneration of the members of the Appeals Board; the appointment and remuneration of the members of the Appeals Board; the functions of the chairperson of the Appeals Board; the functions of the chairperson of the Appeals Board; the establishment of the Secretariat of the Appeals Board; and the establishment of the Secretariat of the Appeals Board; and any other relevant matter. any other relevant matter.

provisions.content: (1) The following enactments are repealed: The following enactments are repealed: the Ghana Institute of Languages Act, 1969 (N.L.C.D. 324); the Ghana Institute of Languages Act, 1969 (N.L.C.D. 324); the National Film and Television Institute Act, 1978 (S.M.C.D. 151); and the National Film and Television Institute Act, 1978 (S.M.C.D. 151); and the Ghana Institute of Journalism Act, 2006 (Act 717). the Ghana Institute of Journalism Act, 2006 (Act 717). provisions.content: (1) Until the appointment of the members of the Council established under section 6, there shall be an Interim Council of the University which shall function for a period of not more than two years.
